oneOf.description: Command used to build a canister
Set of commands used to build a canister

anyOf.description: Local path on-disk to read a WASM file from
Remote url to fetch a WASM file from

Adapter2.description: Configuration for a Pre-built canister build adapter.

sha256.description: Optional sha256 checksum of the WASM

Adapter3.description: Configuration for a custom canister build adapter.

oneOf.description: Directory used to synchronize an assets canister
Set of directories used to synchronize an assets canister

BuildStep.description:
Identifies the type of adapter used to build the canister,
along with its configuration.

The adapter type is specified via the `type` field in the YAML file.
For example:

```yaml
type: script
command: do_something.sh
```

oneOf.description:
Represents a canister built using a custom script or command.
This variant allows for flexible build processes defined by the user.

Represents a pre-built canister.
This variant allows for retrieving a canister WASM from various sources.

BuildSteps.description:
Describes how the canister should be built into WebAssembly,
including the adapters and build steps responsible for the build.

path.description: Local path on-disk to read a WASM file from

LogVisibility.description: Controls who can read canister logs.

oneOf.description: Simple log visibility: 'controllers' (only controllers can view) or 'public' (anyone can view)
Specific principals that can view logs

allowed_viewers.description: List of principal IDs that can view canister logs

items.description: A principal ID that can view logs

sha256.description:
Optional sha256 checksum for the recipe template.
If provided, the integrity of the recipe will be verified against this hash

type.description:
An identifier for a recipe, it can have one of the following formats:

`file://<path_to_recipe>` - point to a local recipe template

`http://<url_to_recipe>` - point to a remote recipe template

`@<registry>/<recipe_name>[@<version>]` - Point to a recipe in a known registry.

For now the only registry is the `dfinity` regitry at https://github.com/dfinity/icp-cli-recipes
`version` is optional and defaults to `latest`

It is always recommended to pin the version and provide a hash for it in the `sha256` field

url.description: Url to fetch the remote WASM file from

Settings.description: Canister settings, such as compute and memory allocation.

compute_allocation.description: Compute allocation (0 to 100). Represents guaranteed compute capacity.

environment_variables.description:
Environment variables for the canister as key-value pairs.
These variables are accessible within the canister and can be used to configure
behavior without hardcoding values in the WASM module.

freezing_threshold.description: Freezing threshold in seconds. Controls how long a canister can be inactive before being frozen.

log_visibility.description: Controls who can read canister logs.

memory_allocation.description: Memory allocation in bytes. If unset, memory is allocated dynamically.

reserved_cycles_limit.description: Reserved cycles limit. If set, the canister cannot consume more than this many cycles.

wasm_memory_limit.description: Wasm memory limit in bytes. Sets an upper bound for Wasm heap growth.

wasm_memory_threshold.description: Wasm memory threshold in bytes. Triggers a callback when exceeded.

SyncStep.description:
Identifies the type of adapter used to sync the canister,
along with its configuration.

The adapter type is specified via the `type` field in the YAML file.
For example:

```yaml
type: script
command: echo "synchronizing canister"
```

oneOf.description:
Represents a canister synced using a custom script or command.
This variant allows for flexible sync processes defined by the user.
Represents syncing of an assets canister

SyncSteps.description: Describes how to synchronize the canister state after deployment.

build.description:
The build configuration specifying how to compile the canister's source
code into a WebAssembly module, including the adapter to use.

sync.description: The configuration specifying how to sync the canister

init_args.description:
Initialization arguments passed to the canister during installation.
Can be hex-encoded bytes or Candid text format.

name.description: The unique name of the canister as defined in this manifest.

settings.description: The configuration specifying the various settings when creating the canister.
